The restaurant is famous for its large burritos, particularly the carne asada, al pastor, California, and breakfast varieties, as well as its super nachos and carne asada fries. Customers frequently praise the flavorful meats, well-seasoned rice and beans, and the selection of salsas. While some find the food exceptional and the prices reasonable, others note that the quality can be inconsistent, with some dishes being too heavy on rice and beans or lacking in flavor. The restaurant has outdoor seating, but parking can be limited.

South Coast Deli is a popular sandwich shop known for its fresh, high-quality ingredients and friendly service. The restaurant is praised for its diverse menu, especially the salads and sandwiches, with the Fowl Play salad and RBC sandwich receiving high marks. Customers appreciate the convenience of online ordering, although some have noted that the in-store pickup process can be inefficient due to a single line for all orders. Despite occasional hiccups in service, the overall consensus is that South Coast Deli offers delicious food and is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

O Street Truck is a food truck known for its sandwiches and fries, though opinions on its bánh mì are mixed, with some finding it a departure from the traditional Vietnamese version, while others enjoy the unique flavors and fillings like the BBQ pork. The French dip is a standout item, praised for its tender meat and flavorful au jus. The fries, especially when paired with the Cha Cha sauce, are consistently well-received. The truck offers generous portions at reasonable prices and provides catering services.

The Natural Cafe offers a casual and healthy dining experience with a focus on fresh ingredients and diverse menu options that cater to various dietary preferences, including vegan, vegetarian, and meat-inclusive dishes. The atmosphere is bright and airy, with both indoor and outdoor seating available. Highly recommended menu items include the Old Town Salad with tahini dressing, Zen Burger, Grilled Chicken Pita, and various smoothies, though the freshness and flavor of the food can be inconsistent. While the service is generally friendly, some customers have reported issues with attentiveness and occasional errors in orders.

Lighthouse Coffee is a cafe known for its spacious and clean environment, offering both indoor and outdoor seating, making it a comfortable spot for work or casual meetups. While some reviewers find the coffee quality inconsistent, noting issues with macchiatos and iced beverages, others praise the lattes and the generous four shots of espresso in their large cups. The breakfast sandwich, especially when customized with an everything bagel, is a highly recommended menu item, along with avocado toast, lox bagels, and yogurt bowls. The cafe also offers alternative milk options and a selection of teas, plus kombucha and local juices. The staff is generally friendly, and the establishment provides convenient amenities like Wi-Fi and parking, plus discounts for healthcare workers.

Whale Tail Deli is a budget-friendly breakfast and lunch spot located in La Arcada Court. Known for its quick service and tasty food, it offers breakfast options like the popular Moby Sandwich with eggs, cheese, and meat on sourdough for around $4, and the even more affordable Old Fashion sandwich. Lunch specials, including a sandwich, fries/salad, and a drink, range from $5-8. The deli also features beer on tap and is situated near the Turtle fountain and the public library.

Kin Bakeshop is a popular pop-up known for its unique and delicious mochi donuts, which have garnered significant buzz and sell out quickly. Customers rave about the donuts' distinct chewy yet light texture and the creative, fresh frostings with innovative flavors like Thai tea, Oreo, and guava. The presentation is also highly praised, with the donuts arriving in beautiful, reflective boxes. Pre-ordering is essential as these sought-after treats are only available for weekend pickup. The owner, Tommy, is frequently mentioned for providing exceptional customer service and kindness, adding to the overall positive experience.

Flagstone Pantry, located in the Santa Barbara Public Market, offers a casual and convenient spot for fresh, healthy grab-and-go meals. Known for its diverse selection of salads, sandwiches, and baked goods with gluten-free, dairy-free, and egg-free options, the restaurant is praised for its flavorful combinations and homemade quality. Popular items include the Figgy Piggy sandwich, soba noodle salad, polenta vegetarian lasagna, and various daily soups like the quinoa and corn soup. While some find the beverages a bit overpriced and the bread sometimes too firm, the overall food quality and friendly service, along with reasonable prices and daily specials like the soup and half-sandwich combo, make it a favorite for a quick and satisfying meal.

The Neighborhood Bar in Santa Barbara offers a laid-back, casual atmosphere with a local vibe, drawing a mixed crowd that appreciates its unpretentious setting. It's known for its fun-loving environment with plenty of activities, including beer pong, ping pong, cornhole, pool, and arcade games, complemented by chalkboard walls for doodling. The bar boasts great happy hour deals on both drinks and food, with specific praise for items like the buffalo wings, pizzas, and tri-tip nachos, although some reviews mention inconsistencies in food quality and occasional service issues. With multiple TVs, it's also a popular spot for watching sports, making it a versatile choice for both casual hangouts and lively gatherings.

A Slice of Woodstock's is a conveniently located pizza place on the UCSB campus with a walk-up window. It offers a limited menu of made-to-order slices, including cheese, pepperoni, vegetarian, combo, and a daily special, as well as salads and Wilde-side bread. Some reviewers find the pizza to be average and overpriced, noting that it's quickly made but not exceptional. Regular customers can benefit from a reward card program.

Located within the Mosaic Locale, Buena Onda offers a delightful experience with its authentic Argentine empanadas, sharing space with a brewery and donut shop. The empanadas are praised for their crispy, flaky crusts and flavorful, well-seasoned fillings, with the carne, caprese, and mushroom options being particularly popular. The chimichurri sauce is a common accompaniment. The location is great for pairing empanadas with beer. While some find the dipping sauce too oily and note slight price differences compared to other locations, the overall quality and taste of the empanadas receive high marks, making it a recommended spot for a savory snack or meal.

La Super-Rica Taqueria, a modest Mexican eatery frequented by Julia Child, is known for its authentic, fresh, and flavorful dishes served in a casual, no-frills environment. Despite weekend lines and limited seating, the restaurant offers a variety of Mexican options, including the popular #16 Super Rica Especial with roasted chiles, cheese, and marinated pork, and the veggie tamales smothered in a creamy white sauce. Customers rave about the homemade tortillas and tasty horchata. The restaurant is cash-only and is closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

Teru Japanese Cuisine is a classy, chef-owned restaurant with a Japanese family-run staff, known for its exceptionally fresh and high-quality fish. While offering a traditional sushi menu, they are also known for unique press box style sushi, similar to Sakana. Standout dishes include the baked spicy eggplant, sautéed mushrooms, and a variety of press boxes like the Sunny press box. The fish is noted for its texture, temperature, and taste, with the uni being a highlight, and the service is attentive. While some found the rolls to be small or the lemon topping too tart, many praise the creative combinations and overall quality, recommending the omakase for an adventurous experience.

Peet's Coffee in Santa Barbara is known for its strong, dark roast coffee that many customers prefer over other chain brands. The cafe is generally described as having a pleasant atmosphere with a classic Peet's vibe, including a dark wood counter and a distinct elegance. Although some reviewers have found the service inconsistent, with some employees being exceptionally friendly and helpful while others are perceived as rude, many praise the baristas for their speed and skill in making beverages. A few reviewers mention that the internet service can be unreliable. The location can be tricky to access, but parking is generally easy once there. While the coffee and espresso drinks receive consistent praise, some reviewers have had issues with the hot chocolate, and others have noted the lack of bagels and public restrooms.

Enterprise Fish Co. is a popular seafood restaurant known for its lively atmosphere and extensive happy hour. The restaurant has a casual vibe, making it suitable for families and groups, but can get crowded and noisy, especially during peak hours. While some reviewers praise the fresh seafood, including the lobster bisque (especially with puff pastry), clam chowder, and swordfish, others have found the food to be inconsistent, with some dishes being bland or overcooked. The service can be hit or miss, with some servers being attentive and friendly, while others are slow or inattentive. Happy hour is a major draw, offering great deals on oysters, appetizers, and drinks.

Blenders In the Grass is a smoothie shop known for its tasty and nutritious treats at reasonable prices, often compared favorably to Jamba Juice. The shop offers a wide variety of smoothie flavors and enhancements, including bee pollen, with the Cranberry and Tropical Guava smoothies receiving high praise. While some find the menu confusing due to the numerous options, the staff is generally considered upbeat and efficient. Despite being more of a "milkshake style treat", rather than a healthy, meal-sufficient smoothie, the supplements can boost the level of quality and veggie juice options are available. Though parking can be challenging and the smoothies may be high in sugar content, Blenders is a popular spot among locals for its consistent quality and refreshing drinks.

Domino's Pizza on State Street in Santa Barbara is a mixed bag, with convenient online ordering and affordable deals like the $7.99 large 3-topping pizza being highlights for some customers. However, numerous reviews mention issues with service, including long wait times, cold or poorly made food (such as burnt cheesy bread or raw bacon), and apathetic or even rude staff, with one manager named Raul receiving repeated negative feedback. While some appreciate the improved pizza quality compared to years past and the ease of ordering, others have experienced chaotic in-store environments and errors with their orders, leading to frustration and a general recommendation to consider alternative pizza options nearby.

Mr B Restaurant & Cafe offers a casual dining experience with a focus on Middle Eastern cuisine, particularly the chicken shawarma, falafel, and hummus, which receive high praise for their authentic flavors. The friendly staff often provides complimentary samples, creating a welcoming environment. While the menu may be limited and some dishes like the beef shawarma and Mr B salad have received mixed reviews, the restaurant is known for its fresh, made-to-order food, with unique items like the shawarma bread and spicy potatoes being popular choices. A distinctive feature is the Jordanian-style shawarma made with imported spices, and the restaurant also offers halal fried chicken, making it a unique culinary destination.

Starbucks at 3815 State St is a small location that can get crowded, particularly during rush hour. While some customers have praised the friendly staff and fast service, others have reported slow service and inconsistencies. There are mixed opinions on the quality of service, with some customers experiencing long wait times and a lack of attention from employees. The location has limited seating inside but offers outdoor seating. The store has received negative feedback for health code violations for allowing non-service dogs inside.

Stateside Restaurant & Lounge appears to be an establishment struggling with consistency and quality. While it holds sentimental value for some, reviews suggest that the food is hit-or-miss, with Asian-style appetizers being just okay and calamari being notably rubbery. Service is criticized for being unprofessional, with untrained staff and slow appetizer service. The atmosphere can be chaotic, especially during events, and the restaurant has faced challenges with inconsistent hours and closures, despite attempts to reassure patrons that it is still open.

C'est Cheese is a specialty food store and cafe that offers a casual and bright atmosphere. The shop is known for its diverse array of cheeses and cured meats, with many customers highlighting the knowledgeable staff who offer samples and recommendations. Grilled cheese sandwiches, particularly the truffle grilled cheese, and tomato soup are popular menu items. In addition to cheese, customers praise the turkey and muffaletta sandwiches, browned butter sea salt cookies, and chocolate chip cookies. The cafe also hosts monthly cheese tastings.

Coral Tree Cafe on the UCSB campus provides a convenient spot for coffee, snacks, breakfast, and lunch. The atmosphere is casual, with indoor and outdoor seating suitable for studying or meeting friends. While the menu offers a wide variety of options, some dishes receive mixed reviews; the breakfast burrito and chicken pita are popular, while the stir-fry is not recommended. The quality of food can vary, but the fries are a standout item. The cafe also offers vegetarian and vegan options, making it a good choice for those with dietary preferences.

Located near the Bacara Resort, the Foley Food and Wine Society Tasting Room offers a diverse selection of wines from Foley's extensive vineyards in California and beyond. The tasting room has a cool and welcoming atmosphere with wooden furniture and decor. Knowledgeable staff guide guests through tasting flights and wine bar service, with options to explore wines from various regions. While the location offers convenience with valet parking, some find it preferable to seek street parking nearby. Although the name includes "food," cheese plates or snacks are not available. The tasting room is a great spot to relax and enjoy a glass or bottle of wine, with the option to take it to the beautiful Bacara property and beachfront gardens.

Rose Cafe is a long-standing, family-owned Mexican diner known for its authentic, home-style cuisine and friendly service. The atmosphere is casual and unpretentious, attracting a loyal local clientele. Highly recommended menu items include the chilaquiles, menudo, machaca, and New Mexico enchiladas, with many praising the homemade salsa. Though some reviewers find certain dishes inconsistent, many appreciate the generous portions, reasonable prices, and the restaurant's commitment to traditional recipes, making it a beloved part of Santa Barbara's culinary history.

The Nugget Bar and Grill is a casual spot with a roomy interior and a cool bar, offering a varied menu with American traditional fare. Happy hour, from 3-7pm daily, features discounted drinks and appetizers. While some reviewers praise specific dishes like the seared ahi appetizer, sliders, and filet mignon, others have criticized the inconsistent food quality, with some finding the food forgettable, and the portion sizes small for the price. Service experiences vary, with some appreciating the friendly and attentive staff, while others note inattentiveness or confusion regarding the order process.

Rusty's Pizza Parlor is a casual pizza joint with a family-friendly atmosphere, offering a menu of pizza, chicken wings, salads, and sandwiches. While some customers praise the pizza as delicious, especially the garlic cheese bread and specialty options like the Diablo Fuego and Hawaiian, others have found the quality inconsistent and comparable to chain pizza. The service quality appears to be a significant issue, with multiple complaints about rude or inattentive staff, incorrect orders, and slow service, although some reviewers have highlighted friendly and helpful employees. The restaurant features a TV and arcade games, creating an old-fashioned pizza parlor vibe, but cleanliness and the handling of customer issues seem to be areas needing improvement.

D'Vine is a popular deli-style sandwich shop with a relaxed atmosphere, offering both indoor and outdoor patio seating. Customers consistently praise the quality and generous portions of the sandwiches, with the Julius (with cranberry sauce), chicken melt, and tri-tip being frequently recommended. While the Austrian roast beef sandwich is considered average, the chicken pot pie receives high marks. The service is generally friendly, although some reviewers have noted occasional slow service during peak hours. Despite being listed as kid-friendly, some customers have found the presence of delicate items and potential reactions to children a concern, suggesting caution for families with young children. Overall, D'Vine is known for its tasty food, diverse menu, and pleasant environment, making it a great spot for a casual meal.

Merci To Go is a popular café and bakery known for its fresh, healthy, and delicious food. The establishment offers a variety of well-packaged items, including salads, faro, couscous, and quiche, with a focus on clean eating. Patrons rave about the melt-in-your-mouth brownies, chocolate caramels, and open egg salad, with some noting that these items occasionally sell out quickly due to their popularity. It's a great spot for a quick, fuss-free bite, where customers can enjoy high-quality baguettes, duck confit, and well-dressed salads.

Brasil Arts Cafe is a casual, Brazilian-influenced cafe with a vibrant and artsy atmosphere, often featuring live music and dance classes in the back. The menu is extensive, offering a wide variety of options from juices and smoothies to heartier fare like the popular P.F. (Prato Feito) combo plate, sea bass, and Brazilian burgers.  Praised for their authentic Brazilian flavors and unique dishes like Coxinha and Pão de Queijo, the cafe is a local favorite. Though some reviewers note that the food is pricey with inconsistent service and small portion sizes, while others have expressed issues regarding health code violations, the friendly staff and high-quality food make it a worthwhile dining experience.

Harbor of Santa Barbara Inc is a beautiful, touristy harbor with a variety of activities, including restaurants, amusements, events, and beach access. While the dockage fees may be high and the area can be crowded with people, the staff is generally considered great. A major concern is the excessive use of straws in restaurants and drink shops, with calls for a transition to straw-less practices to protect marine life, encouraging visitors to bring their own reusable cups and straws, and for shops to offer discounts for those who do.

Momma Donna is a restaurant with a hipster vibe and eclectic decor, known for taking American bar eats to the next level. The restaurant is particularly praised for its unique and delicious burgers, such as the Gogi Burger (Korean barbeque beef) and the PBJ Burger (peanut butter, jelly, and bacon). The mac and cheese is also a standout item. The quality of the food is exceptional, with fresh, locally sourced ingredients like free-range beef. The service is friendly and welcoming, creating a warm and comfortable atmosphere, making it a favorite late-night spot.

Le Petit Bistro is a French restaurant that has received overwhelmingly negative reviews, with many customers citing bizarre and disappointing dining experiences. The atmosphere is described as having a cute upstairs space, but with filthy carpets and missing padding in booths. The quality of food is a major concern, with reports of raw croissants, cold crêpes, and poorly prepared dishes like magret de canard and overcooked beef. Service is consistently criticized as being rude, inattentive, and incompetent, with instances of forgotten orders, slow service, and incorrect bills. The wine list is considered mediocre, with limited options and overpriced selections. Overall, customers express strong dissatisfaction and a lack of desire to return, citing the restaurant as a shame for French cuisine and service.

Delicious Expressions is a highly-regarded bakery and caterer, though it is not a brick and mortar store. It is known for its exceptional customer service and delectable baked goods, especially cupcakes and cakes. Customers consistently praise the ease of ordering, the prompt and reliable delivery service, and the personal touch, such as handwritten notes and photos of the delivery. The quality of the baked goods is consistently described as delicious, with specific mentions of red velvet cake, Nutella cupcakes, and salted caramel vanilla cake being particularly outstanding. Delicious Expressions is a favorite for birthdays, weddings, and special occasions, offering a wide variety of options and accommodating last-minute requests with a personal and caring approach.

Little Kitchen offers a hip and casual atmosphere with a menu of modern comfort food. Praised dishes include the Swedish meatballs, chicken tikka masala, Brussels sprouts, and cheeseburger egg rolls, alongside vegan options like the Impossible Burger and vegan tacos. While most find the food delicious and the service friendly and efficient, some have noted inconsistencies, such as overly salty dishes and slow service at times. A unique aspect is its late-night hours and location next to the Wildcat Lounge, making it a popular spot for late-night eats, while the ambiance and convenient location just off State Street add to its appeal.

Sage & Onion is a charming spot located just off State Street, known for its lovely atmosphere and high-quality American (New) cuisine. The restaurant impresses with dishes like the duck, seared ahi tuna in coconut curry lemongrass sauce, and perfectly cooked diver scallops accompanied by roasted root vegetables and sautéed broccolini. The truffled white cheddar soufflé is a highly recommended appetizer, and the chocolate cake is a popular dessert option. The service is generally attentive and pleasant, contributing to a delightful dining experience, often complemented by thoughtful gestures from the owner.

Lito's Take Out is a casual Mexican eatery known for its authentic and generously portioned food, often enjoyed for breakfast and lunch. The atmosphere is characterized as a "hole-in-the-wall" with limited seating and a newly redesigned interior. Highly recommended menu items include the carnitas (especially in burritos or tacos, and featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives), pozole, chile verde, and breakfast burritos (chorizo, egg & potato is a popular choice). The quality of the food is generally praised as fresh and flavorful, with some customers noting the homemade tortillas and salsa. The service receives mixed reviews, with some finding it friendly and efficient, while others have experienced rudeness.

Char West, located on Stearns Wharf in Santa Barbara, is a fast-food establishment with a touristy ambiance, offering a menu of American classics like fish and chips, burgers, and breakfast items. While the location offers nice ocean views, the restaurant receives mixed reviews regarding the quality of its food and service. The fish and chips are a popular choice, but many customers have criticized the dish for being overpriced, greasy, and made with frozen fish, while some others enjoyed it. Some reviewers have also expressed disappointment with other menu items such as the clam chowder, coffee, and shrimp, describing them as flavorless, watery, or of poor quality. The service is often described as rude and apathetic, with staff appearing uncaring and unhelpful. However, some customers have praised the breakfast menu, specifically the wheat germ pancakes, and found the staff friendly.

Petros Restaurant in Santa Barbara offers a Greek and Mediterranean dining experience with a romantic ambiance, featuring both indoor and outdoor seating, including a courtyard with a fireplace. While the atmosphere and setting receive praise, the restaurant's food and service quality appear inconsistent. Some diners rave about the authentic flavors, particularly the lamb dishes, bougatsa, and dip samplers, noting fresh ingredients and expertly cooked meals, and desserts. However, others criticize the food as bland, inauthentic, and overpriced, citing issues with over-seasoning, dryness, and small portions. Service experiences vary widely, with some guests highlighting attentive and friendly staff, particularly singling out Dimitri for exceptional service, while many others report slow, disorganized, and inattentive service, including long waits, forgotten orders, and a lack of attentiveness.

Olio E Limone Ristorante offers a classy and romantic Italian dining experience in a small, sometimes cramped setting. The restaurant is known for its authentic Italian cuisine, with the duck ravioli and black calamari being particularly praised, while the truffle mushroom pizza and cheese plate are recommended as well. The salmon special is another standout dish. Some reviewers found the service to be inattentive or even rude, while others lauded the friendly staff and attentive service, but overall, the restaurant is known for its creative and well-executed dishes.

Hustle & Grind Coffee Company, located in downtown Santa Barbara, is a popular spot known for its quality coffee, unique flavor combinations, and friendly service. The cafe shares a space with ParadICE, offering both coffee and Hawaiian shaved ice, creating a unique and welcoming atmosphere with outdoor seating. Customers rave about the lavender molasses latte, maple sea salt latte, and honey latte, with the option of house-made almond or oat milk. In addition to coffee, they serve a variety of toasts, including the popular El Chingon and Queen B, made with fresh bread from a local bakery.

Tacos Pipeye is a casual, authentic Mexican eatery known for its delicious and generously filled tacos on freshly handmade tortillas. Patrons rave about the variety of flavorful meats, including barbacoa, pastor, and carnitas, as well as unique options like pork belly and fish tacos. The restaurant boasts an impressive salsa bar with a range of heat levels and unique options like creamy avocado and peanut salsa. With a welcoming atmosphere and reasonable prices, Tacos Pipeye is a local favorite, often mentioned as a top spot for street tacos in Santa Barbara, especially noted for its flavorful barbacoa, quesadillas and Champurrado.

Rusty's Pizza Parlor is a casual pizza joint known for its thin-crust pizza and a basic salad bar. The Carrillo Street location stands out with its unique, old pub-style building, reminiscent of a medieval times castle with dark wood and stone accents, and an upstairs meeting room. While opinions on the pizza vary, with some finding it average and pricey, others praise specific combinations like pineapple, jalapeño, and pepperoni, and the "El Diablo" pizza. The service quality appears inconsistent, with some customers reporting friendly and fast service, while others cite rude staff, slow delivery, and issues with order accuracy. Some unique features include arcade games, pitchers of cheap beer, and a popular "quick lunch" special.

Located within the Four Seasons Biltmore in Santa Barbara, Bella Vista offers a classy, elegant dining experience with breathtaking ocean views, especially from its outdoor patio. The restaurant is known for its extensive Sunday brunch buffet, featuring high-quality items like caviar, crab legs, sushi, and a chocolate fountain, though some find it pricey. While some reviewers praise specific dishes like the lobster brioche sandwich, dark chocolate soufflé, and handmade pastas, others note that the food quality can be inconsistent and sometimes underwhelming, with mixed opinions on the freshness and flavor of certain items. Service generally receives positive feedback for attentiveness, although some guests have reported slow or inattentive service.

Renaud's Patisserie & Bistro is a charming French cafe known for its cozy atmosphere, making it a popular spot for breakfast and brunch. The almond croissant stands out as a highly praised menu item, with many reviewers claiming it's the best they've ever had, highlighting its buttery, flaky layers and generous almond filling. Other popular items include the macarons, quiche Lorraine, and various croissant sandwiches. While most reviewers rave about the food quality, some have noted that the service can be inconsistent and occasionally unfriendly. The cafe's Parisian pastries and dog-friendly patio create a delightful experience for visitors.

Cajun Kitchen Cafe offers a casual and cozy atmosphere, known for its consistently good food and friendly service, though it can get quite busy, especially on weekends. The menu features a mix of traditional American breakfast fare and Cajun-inspired dishes, with standout items like the Roz's omelet, cheese grits, huevos rancheros, and various Benedicts. While some reviewers praise specific dishes like the jambalaya, Cajun pizza, and beignets, others find the Cajun-style food subpar, with mixed opinions on the egg dishes and some inconsistencies in food quality. Unique aspects include homemade salsa, apple butter, and cornbread, along with Dune Coffee Roasters espresso.

Mundos is a casual, family-owned restaurant with a funky, artsy vibe that offers a diverse menu of Latin American, Asian Fusion, and other cuisines, with many vegetarian and gluten-free options. The restaurant is known for its unique and flavorful tacos, such as the picanha, Korean buffalo BBQ, and fried chickpea tacos, as well as the plantain Brazilian steak sandwich. While some reviewers found the food to be bland or lacking in flavor, others raved about the creative flavor combinations and fresh ingredients, particularly in dishes like the smoked mushroom taco, veggie panini, and buffalo burger served on plantains. The service is generally friendly, though some reviewers noted that it can be a bit awkward or slow, and the restaurant is still finding its groove.

Peabody's is a casual spot with a relaxed, local hangout vibe, offering outdoor seating. While praised for its generous drinks and reasonable prices, the food quality appears inconsistent. Some customers rave about the breakfasts, particularly the Bloody Marys, and pub fare like burgers, nachos, and fish tacos. However, there are complaints about slow service, undercooked or overly salty dishes, and a stuffy atmosphere. The recent change in ownership has brought some cosmetic improvements, but concerns remain about maintaining the restaurant's value and unique character in the face of increasing prices in the area.

Mandarin Palace offers a casual dining experience with a wide range of American-style Chinese dishes, as well as some authentic Chinese options from a "secret" Chinese menu upon request. While the quality can be inconsistent, the lunch specials are frequently praised for their value and generous portions, including soup, salad, and appetizers alongside the entree. Some popular dishes include the honey walnut shrimp, Kung Pao chicken, and the amazing ribs. However, the orange chicken and wonton soup receive mixed reviews, with some customers finding them bland or greasy. Service experiences vary, with some diners reporting friendly and efficient service, while others have encountered slow or inattentive staff.

Milpas Taqueria is a casual, family-friendly Mexican restaurant that is somewhat hidden but worth seeking out. The handmade tacos are highly recommended, especially the adobada and asada, and the hot dogs are a surprising favorite. The food is considered authentic and delicious, with fresh ingredients and a good salsa bar. The service is friendly and welcoming, and the restaurant is clean and cozy. Despite its bare-bones appearance and small size, the quality of the food and the welcoming atmosphere make it a standout spot.

Louie's California Bistro is a charming and romantic restaurant, often described as a hidden gem, located within the Upham Hotel. The bistro offers a cozy and classy atmosphere, with outdoor seating on the veranda being a favorite among patrons. While the service is generally attentive and friendly, some reviewers have noted inconsistencies. Highly recommended dishes include the crab dumplings, rack of lamb, filet mignon, chicken puff pastry, and the famed Banana a la Louie dessert. While most reviewers praise the food quality and creative menu, some found certain dishes, like the meatloaf and some seafood options, to be bland or inconsistent.

Blush Lounge in Santa Barbara presents a trendy and inviting atmosphere, enhanced by a cute outdoor space featuring heat lamps and fire pits, making it a cozy spot year-round. The menu boasts a variety of American (New) dishes, with happy hour specials drawing considerable attention, offering discounted beers, well drinks, wine, cocktails, and appetizers like filet mignon bites and roasted artichoke. While some patrons praise the Blush burger, short rib grilled cheese, and lobster mac and cheese, others criticize the food quality and high prices; the service quality seems inconsistent. The lounge's offerings include a range of cocktails such as the strawberry basil martini and pineapple smash, appealing to those who enjoy a lively bar scene alongside their meals.

La Salsa is a casual Mexican restaurant known for its convenient location and reasonable prices, but it appears that quality and service can be inconsistent. While some customers praise the fresh, made-to-order food, authentic style without grease, and diverse salsa bar, others have noted issues such as distracted staff, tough steak in burritos, and tortillas that are not heated well. There have also been complaints about disruptive cleaning activities (mopping, window cleaning) occurring while customers are eating, and excessively loud music. The Baja grilled fish is recommended by some, as are the Mexico City tacos and nachos.

Taqueria El Buen Gusto is a popular, casual Mexican eatery known for its authentic flavors and generous portions at reasonable prices. It has a divey and casual atmosphere. The restaurant is particularly praised for its tacos, especially the carnitas, asada, and fish tacos, with many recommending the lengua torta and super burritos. Other highlights include the horchata, carne asada super nachos, and seafood dishes like the fried tilapia and cocktail de camaron. Some reviewers note the freshness and quality of ingredients, while others mention the potential for long wait times and occasional cleanliness issues. Despite mixed comments on the ambiance, the food and friendly service make it a favorite among locals and visitors seeking a satisfying Mexican meal.

Henning's Cake Boutique is known for its professional service and willingness to accommodate custom cake designs, making it a popular choice for special occasions like weddings and birthdays. While the cakes, particularly the white cake with buttercream frosting and fresh strawberry filling, receive high praise for their flavor and quality, the cupcakes have been criticized for being dry and lacking flavor, with some customers comparing them to grocery store cupcakes. The staff is generally friendly and helpful, and the boutique offers a random selection of juices alongside its baked goods.

Coast Restaurant & Bar, located in the Canary Hotel, offers a classy and inviting ambiance, though some reviewers have noted noise levels can be high. The restaurant has received mixed reviews regarding the food quality, with some diners praising dishes like the crab cake Caesar salad, tri-tip sandwich with truffle fries, and sliders, while others have criticized items such as the lamb ravioli and fish entrees. Happy hour is popular, featuring $2 tacos on Thursdays and other specials, and the restaurant is known for its creative cocktails. Service experiences vary, with some customers lauding attentive staff and others reporting issues with attentiveness and long wait times, especially during special events.

European Deli Market is a well-regarded grocery store and deli known for its diverse selection of Eastern European and Middle Eastern products, including halal meats, cheeses, spices, and specialty items. While it's not a restaurant, customers appreciate the variety of unique ingredients, fresh produce, and imported goods that are hard to find elsewhere. The market's atmosphere is that of a traditional international market, with a focus on providing a wide range of options for those seeking specific cultural foods or unique cooking ingredients. Some customers have noted inconsistent customer service experiences, but overall, the deli is praised for its friendly staff and reasonable prices, making it a popular destination for those looking to explore international flavors.

Nardonne's La Famiglia Pizzeria is a casual, family-friendly Italian restaurant known for its thick-crust, Sicilian-style pizza with generous toppings and a tangy tomato sauce. The atmosphere is described as charming and inviting, with friendly and attentive service. The garlic bread is highly recommended as a must-try item. While some find the pizza exceptional and praise the fresh ingredients, others have noted inconsistencies in topping distribution, excessive dough, and burnt cheese. Despite mixed opinions on the pizza, the restaurant is often lauded for its customer service and reasonable prices, making it a popular spot for both dine-in and delivery.

Pace food+drink is a casual, family-run restaurant with a funky vibe, offering American cuisine with fresh, locally sourced ingredients and some Asian/Hawaiian influences. The Papa Burger stands out as a highly recommended menu item, praised for its fresh ingredients and homemade bun, with the Hawaiian plate and fish tacos also receiving positive mentions. Calamari fries are a popular appetizer. While some reviewers noted that the service can be slow, most appreciate the friendly staff and the made-to-order dishes. The restaurant occasionally features live music, adding to the atmosphere.

Del Pueblo Cafe is a casual Mexican restaurant known for its unique and vibrant atmosphere, filled with colorful art and decor that transports diners to a different place. While some reviewers find the food inconsistent, certain dishes receive high praise, including the mole enchiladas, sopes, and alambre azteca. The restaurant is also known for its flavorful and authentic Mexican dishes, such as the pollo en lechado and camarones rancheros, as well as the best horchata. The service is generally friendly and attentive, though some reviewers have noted occasional slowness or inattentiveness. With reasonable prices and a diverse menu, Del Pueblo Cafe offers a unique dining experience that appeals to both locals and visitors looking for a taste of authentic Mexican cuisine.

Vons in Santa Barbara appears to have mixed reviews regarding its overall quality and service. While some customers appreciate the floral section and organized layout, others have raised concerns about cleanliness and customer service. Some customers have complained about long waits and unhelpful staff, particularly in the deli section. There are also complaints about the quality of certain items, like burnt chicken, and issues with the floral department regarding prepaid orders. However, there are positive comments about specific employees in the meat department who provide excellent customer service. The store also participates in promotional games like Monopoly and offers a rewards program for discounts, but some customers have noted that the store's lighting is darker than expected.

Sevtap Winery Tasting Room offers a unique and relaxed wine-tasting experience with a funky, casual vibe, often featuring live music and chalkboard walls for customer art. While some reviewers find the wines to be just okay or overpriced, others rave about specific selections like "Wish You Were Here" Sangiovese and the "Serendipity" Sauvignon Blanc, alongside homemade breads and small plates. The service quality varies, with some praising the friendly and engaging owner, Art, and the knowledgeable staff, while others report instances of rudeness and unprofessionalism. Overall, Sevtap aims for a fun, social atmosphere, making it a popular spot for those seeking a less pretentious wine-tasting experience.

The Endless Summer Bar Cafe offers a casual dining experience with a fantastic view of the harbor, particularly from its rooftop seating area. While the atmosphere, complete with live music and free popcorn, is generally praised, opinions on the food are mixed, with some dishes like the clam chowder and cioppino receiving criticism, while others, such as the fish and chips and salmon tacos, are better received. Service quality appears inconsistent, with some customers reporting attentive and friendly staff, while others experienced slow or inattentive service. Despite some concerns about food quality and service, the restaurant remains a popular spot for drinks, happy hour, and enjoying the view.

Whitefoot Meat Market is a traditional, locally loved butcher shop known for its high-quality meats and personal service. Customers rave about the Kobe beef ribs and especially the tri-tip sandwiches, with the recommendation to add salsa for the best flavor. The market is also known for its excellent ham hocks, perfect for soups and stews, and offers custom seasoning for meats. While they offer sliced deli meats, their meatball subs served on Wednesdays are a standout item.

Gloria's Gourmet Kitchen is a popular taco truck known for its authentic and fresh Mexican food, often considered better than many local restaurants. The steak burritos and tacos, especially the pastor and asada, are highly praised for their delicious flavors and perfect preparation, and the burritos are noted for being perfectly grilled. Each order is served with fresh accompaniments like radishes, grilled onions, and grilled jalapeños, complemented by red and green salsas. The restaurant offers additional refreshments such as pineapple and cucumber agua fresca. A downside mentioned by some customers is potentially long wait times for orders.

Bar 29 in Santa Barbara is a popular spot known for its intimate and classy atmosphere, offering a modern, sleek vibe. It is celebrated for its inventive cocktails and tasty, shareable small plates, with happy hour specials on select drinks and bites. Highly recommended menu items include the pork belly pops, poutine with short rib gravy, wagyu beef sliders, and rosemary garlic fries, alongside creative cocktails like the Mesa and Spirit of the Riviera. While some reviewers have noted occasional issues with service attentiveness and noise levels, the majority praise the quality of the food and drinks, the friendly staff, and the unique twists on classic bar fare, making it a great place for late-night meals and drinks.

Santa Barbara Roasting Company, known locally as RoCo, is a coffee shop with a distinctive, laid-back atmosphere that is popular among both locals and tourists. The cafe is known for roasting its own beans, offering a variety of blends and specialty drinks, including their well-regarded espresso, cappuccinos, and unique options like the Yerbalicious and spicy almond chai. While some reviewers praise the strong and flavorful coffee, others find it inconsistent, occasionally describing it as burnt or weak and there are mixed reviews on food items such as pastries and bagels. The staff receives mixed feedback, with some customers reporting friendly and helpful service, while others have experienced rudeness or inattentiveness. The cafe provides free Wi-Fi and ample seating, making it a popular spot for studying and working and the shop's rustic decor and the aroma of roasted beans create a pleasant, albeit sometimes crowded, environment.

Piranha Restaurant & Sushi Bar is a trendy, contemporary Japanese spot with a lively atmosphere, featuring high ceilings, multi-level seating, and colorful lighting. While some find it overpriced with small portions and an underwhelming sake/wine list, others praise the unique and delicious food, particularly the crunchy filo-wrapped Chilean sea bass and carpaccio plates with yuzu or ponzu sauces. The sushi menu offers outside-the-box specialty rolls, with some combinations standing out more than others, like the Truffle Pig roll.

Kai Sushi Shabu-Shabu is a casual Japanese restaurant that receives mixed reviews, particularly regarding its sushi. While some customers praise the freshness and creative rolls, others find the sushi to be overpriced, inconsistent in quality, and sometimes not fresh, with small portions. However, the shabu-shabu is more consistently praised as a fun and delicious experience, featuring fresh ingredients, though some find it pricey and lacking a flavorful broth or soup base. Service experiences vary widely, with some diners reporting friendly and attentive staff, while others cite slow, rude, or inattentive service. The restaurant offers happy hour specials and is known for some unique rolls like the Tokyo Rose, but opinions diverge significantly, leading to an overall inconsistent customer experience.

MIZZA is an Italian restaurant located on State Street in Santa Barbara, offering a casual yet classy dining experience with both indoor and outdoor seating, complete with heated patios and a lively atmosphere perfect for people-watching. The menu features a variety of Italian dishes, including well-received pizzas with fresh ingredients and truffle oil, handmade pasta (especially the shrimp pasta in vodka sauce), and meatballs. Some reviewers recommend the antipasto, bruschetta, and burrata, while some diners have noted inconsistencies in the quality of service, with some servers being attentive and friendly, and others struggling with order accuracy and attentiveness. Despite mixed experiences with service, the quality and variety of the food, including vegan options, make MIZZA a popular destination for both locals and tourists.

La Tapatia Bakery is a small, authentic Mexican restaurant and bakery known for its traditional dishes and fresh pastries. The atmosphere is casual and often crowded, with communal seating.  Highly praised menu items include the chicken mole, various soups like caldo de pollo and caldo de res (especially as a hangover cure), and homemade tortillas. The bakery section offers a variety of pan dulce, with the butterfly pastry being a standout. While most reviewers praise the food quality and authenticity, some have noted issues with slow or rude service and cleanliness.  The restaurant is a cash-only establishment.

Mexican Fresh is a casual spot known for its affordable Mexican food and happy hour deals, particularly the cheap tacos and margaritas. The restaurant offers outdoor seating and is noted for its friendly service. While some customers praise the fresh ingredients and flavorful options like the carnitas and fish tacos (especially the swordfish), others find the food bland or inconsistent. Criticisms include the quality of the tortillas, limited menu, and cleanliness issues. Despite mixed opinions, the restaurant is appreciated for its reasonable prices and satisfying portions, making it a popular choice for a quick and budget-friendly meal.

Nicky D's Wood Fired Pizza is a casual, neighborhood pizzeria known for its New York-style, thin-crust pizza cooked in a wood-fired oven. The restaurant is praised for its friendly owner, New York-style pizza, and fast service. Key menu items include the white clam pizza, mozzarella sticks, and garlic bread. Some customers have reported issues with delivery times, pizza quality, and service, with some pizzas arriving cold or undercooked. However, many rave about the pizza's authentic taste and fresh ingredients.

Jersey Mike's Subs in Santa Barbara is a fast-food deli that receives mixed reviews. While many customers appreciate the fresh-cut deli sandwiches and the quality of the catering options, some find the service to be inconsistent, with reports of unenthusiastic staff and messy dining areas. The sandwiches themselves are generally well-received, particularly when ordered "Mike's Way" with oil and vinegar, although there are complaints about skimping on meat for the price. A standout feature mentioned is the exceptional service provided by some employees, who are praised for their positive attitudes and attentiveness, while others have been cited as not following COVID-19 mask policies.

Norton's Pastrami & Deli is a small, casual eatery known for its hearty sandwiches and appearances on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. The restaurant is often packed, offering limited seating and encouraging customers to share tables. The "Mom's PLT," featuring crispy pastrami, lettuce, tomato, and chipotle mayo, is a highly recommended and popular choice, along with the classic pastrami and Reuben sandwiches. While the quality of the pastrami itself is generally praised, the "NYC" sandwich and pastrami dip are also notable. The onion rings also receive praise. Some reviewers mention that the sandwiches can be greasy and salty, and seating can be an issue during busy times.

The Monarch is a classy restaurant with mixed reviews regarding its execution. While some diners have had exceptional experiences, praising dishes like the short rib, abalone, and doughnuts, others have been disappointed by the overpriced menu, small portion sizes, and inconsistent food quality, such as lukewarm dishes and tough abalone. The family-style dining concept has also received mixed reactions, with some finding it enjoyable and others feeling it's more of a production than a genuine dining experience. Service quality seems inconsistent, with reports ranging from attentive and informative servers to slow and inattentive service. Overall, the restaurant's ambiance is generally well-received, but issues with noise levels and the value for money have been raised.

Tydes Restaurant, located within the Coral Casino Cabana Club and operated by the Four Seasons, offers an upscale dining experience with stunning panoramic ocean views. The atmosphere is generally calm and relaxing, with a decor that caters to an older crowd, and the service is often praised as excellent and attentive. Some standout dishes include the Mediterranean Branzino, the brussel sprouts, and the lobster truffle pasta, while others, like the bouillabaisse and Kobe burger, have received criticism for quality and value. Keep in mind that access to the restaurant requires either a Coral Casino membership or being a guest at the Four Seasons Biltmore Resort, and prices can be high, particularly for non-members.

Luna Grill is a trendy and casual Mediterranean restaurant known for its fresh and healthy cuisine. While the quality of the food is generally praised, some reviewers have noted inconsistencies in food preparation, such as charred chicken kebobs and undercooked meats, and occasionally slow service. The restaurant offers a variety of dishes, with the signature plates being a popular choice, while the gyro and kabob plates also receive positive feedback. However, some customers find the portions small for the price, particularly for items like the lamb kabob and wraps. Despite some criticisms, the restaurant is often commended for its clean environment, friendly staff, and accommodating service, with many appreciating the option of outdoor patio seating.

Spice Avenue offers a casual Indian dining experience on State Street, with both indoor and covered outdoor seating. While some reviewers praise the Chicken Tikka Masala, garlic naan, and lunch buffet (especially the Saag Paneer), others have criticized the food for being bland, overpriced for the portion sizes, and inconsistent in quality, with some dishes tasting recycled or not fresh. Service experiences vary widely, with some customers reporting friendly and attentive staff, while others describe rude, inattentive, or even racist behavior, as well as issues with cleanliness. The restaurant has a history of charging extra for rice and offering small portions for a high price.

Sam's to Go - Milpas is a casual spot known for its fresh sandwiches and burgers, with a wide selection available in various sizes. The #26 chicken bacon avocado sandwich is a popular recommendation. While the food is generally considered good and the prices reasonable, the restaurant has received criticism regarding its service and hygiene practices. Some reviewers have reported issues with staff attitude, cleanliness, and food handling procedures, while others have praised the owner's helpfulness with catering orders. Although the restaurant could use a remodel, it remains a local favorite for a quick and affordable meal.

Sachi Ramen and Robata Bar offers a casual dining experience with both indoor and outdoor seating, including a dog-friendly patio. While opinions on the ramen vary, some customers praise specific dishes like the spicy tonkotsu ramen, crispy chicken ramen, and shrimp ramen, while others find the broth bland or lacking authentic flavors. The quality of ingredients and the execution of dishes appear inconsistent, with some reviewers highlighting the tenderness of the pork and the perfect soft-boiled eggs, while others criticize the meat quality and the temperature of the ingredients. Service experiences range from friendly and attentive to awkward and slow, with some customers noting inexperienced servers. Despite mixed reviews, many appreciate the variety of ramen options, the availability of happy hour, and the restaurant's efforts to accommodate dietary preferences.

Lab Social offers a unique experience as a coffee shop by day and a speakeasy-style bar by night, featuring a hidden entrance and a cool, intimate atmosphere with black and white movies playing. The craft cocktails are a highlight, with creative and well-balanced drinks like the Churchill Sour, Lucky's Revenge, and variations of the Negroni and Old Fashioned being highly recommended. The quality of the drinks is praised, especially during happy hour, and the bartenders are noted for their expertise and friendly service. While the food menu is limited to small bites like bar nuts, pickled vegetables, and flatbreads, the overall vibe and unique drink offerings make it a standout spot in Santa Barbara's bar scene.

Miso Hungry is a casual spot where you can customize your own sushi bowls, salads, or wraps, similar to a Chipotle-style setup. The restaurant is known for its fresh ingredients and a wide variety of options, allowing customers to create their own unique combinations with different proteins, veggies, and sauces. Some customers rave about the quality of the fish and the flavorful sauces, recommending the rainbow bowl and the spicy tuna wrap. However, others have noted that the portions of fish can be small, and the execution can sometimes be inconsistent, with some finding the food bland or the rice undercooked. The restaurant also features a unique iced tea bar where customers can mix and match different teas and juices.

Shoreline Beach Cafe is a casual beachfront restaurant with an unbeatable location right on Leadbetter Beach, where patrons can enjoy their meals with their feet in the sand. The cafe is known for its stunning ocean views and relaxed atmosphere, with options for both covered patio and beachside seating. While the food quality receives mixed reviews, with some praising the fish tacos, clam chowder, and the fresh catch of the day, others find the menu items to be average and overpriced, recommending it more for the experience and drinks. The service also varies, with some customers reporting attentive and friendly staff, while others describe slow or inattentive service.

Montecito Deli & Catering is a family-owned deli that's known for its unique Italian piadinas, with fresh dough made daily, and its use of fresh ingredients. The roast beef piandina and rosemary chicken sandwich are highly recommended, as is the homemade chicken tortilla soup, which is available one day a week and often sells out quickly. The deli also offers a make-your-own wrap option. While most reviewers praise the food quality and freshness, some have noted that the sandwiches can be skimpy for the price and occasionally bland.

Blenders In The Grass, a Santa Barbara staple, is a casual smoothie and juice bar known for its generous portions and wide variety of flavors. The atmosphere is energetic, though it can get noisy due to the blenders. While some find the smoothies healthier than Jamba Juice, others note that many concoctions contain sherbet or ice milk, giving them a sweeter, less natural taste. Highly recommended smoothies include the Peanut Butter, Blue Pomegranate, Tropical Mango, Red Banana, and the Original, with customers appreciating the option to customize their drinks and add supplements. A "secret" menu offers unique combinations like the Betterfinger. Though primarily a smoothie place, Blenders also offers acai bowls and fresh juices.

El Sitio is a casual, hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant known for its authentic and flavorful food, particularly the carne asada tortas, carnitas tacos, and various burritos like the verde and fajita options. While the food generally receives high praise for taste and quality, especially the beans and rice, some reviewers have noted inconsistencies and occasional issues with blandness. The service and atmosphere are areas of concern for some customers, with complaints about unfriendly staff, language barriers, and cleanliness. Despite these drawbacks, many customers appreciate the generous portions, reasonable prices, and the overall authentic Mexican food experience.

Maeda Restaurant is an all-you-can-eat sushi establishment known for its quality fish, including both normal sushi and more rare options like ono or local yellowtail when available. While the portions are slightly smaller due to the all-you-can-eat format, the restaurant generally maintains good fish quality. However, there have been instances of order mix-ups and unavailability of specific fish, leading to customer dissatisfaction.

Derf's Cafe is a casual, neighborhood spot with a dive bar atmosphere that has been a Santa Barbara staple for many years. Known for its reasonable prices and friendly staff, Derf's offers a diverse menu with breakfast served all day and a popular weekday breakfast special. The burgers, especially the bacon cheeseburger, are highly praised, along with the fries and appetizers. The large patio is a plus, though it can get crowded. While some reviewers have lauded the attentive service and generous portions, others have complained about slow service, inattentive waitstaff, and inconsistent food quality, with some dishes receiving criticism for being tasteless or poorly prepared.

Stearns Wharf in Santa Barbara offers a quintessential seaside experience, blending scenic views with tourist-friendly amenities. The wharf provides stunning panoramic views of the mountains and ocean. It's characterized by a variety of restaurants offering seafood and other dining options, alongside souvenir shops and a small sea life museum. The unique feature of being able to drive onto the pier adds to its appeal, though parking can be limited. While some find it charming and peaceful, others feel it lacks the attractions of larger piers and can be overly touristy, especially when crowded, also be aware of limited safety railings. Despite mixed opinions, Stearns Wharf remains a popular spot for leisurely strolls, sunset viewing, and enjoying the coastal atmosphere.

Revolver is a trendy, divey pizza joint known for its New York-inspired pizzas with a unique sourdough crust. While some find the small interior and patio charming, parking can be challenging. The pizzas, made with high-quality ingredients, receive high praise, especially the pepperoni and white pizza with seasonal vegetables, though the Margherita sometimes lacks flavor. The crust is often described as thin, charred, and chewy, but some find it burnt or too crispy. While most appreciate the fresh ingredients and overall quality, some diners have noted inconsistent service, long wait times, and high prices for the portion size. The music and vibe are generally considered cool, but can be loud.

Chuck's of Hawaii offers a casual, old-school steakhouse experience with a dimly lit, "crowded pirate ship-like" atmosphere. Known for its simple menu and consistent quality, the restaurant highlights include steaks, fresh fish, and a salad bar that many praise. While some reviewers find the food to be consistently delicious, easy, and reliable, others consider it average or overpriced, with occasional inconsistencies in cooking and seasoning. The service receives mixed feedback, ranging from friendly and attentive to inattentive, even rude. Unique aspects of Chuck's include its Hawaiian theme, menu presented on a wine bottle, and a popular happy hour.

Satellite is a trendy and intimate downtown spot with a lively atmosphere, known for its exceptional service and knowledgeable staff. It stands out with its unique focus on vegan and vegetarian cuisine, sourcing fresh, local ingredients from the farmers market. The menu features creative dishes like the Yoga Pants Salad and Beech Ceviche, which receive high praise for their flavor and presentation, along with homemade focaccia. The wine selection is extensive, featuring both local and international options, and the staff is skilled at pairing wines with the food. With its modern decor, comfortable seating, and a focus on fresh, plant-based cuisine, Satellite offers a refreshing and satisfying dining experience.

Brophy Bros - Santa Barbara is a popular seafood restaurant known for its casual and lively atmosphere, offering stunning harbor and mountain views. While some reviewers mention a "touristy" vibe and potential waits, the location and fresh seafood are key draws. The clam chowder is consistently praised as a must-try, while other popular dishes include garlic baked clams, oyster shooters, and fish and chips. Reviewers note the portions are generous, the service is generally friendly, and prices are reasonable. Though some find the menu limited and the space crowded, many appreciate the quality and value, making it a go-to spot for a seafood meal with a view.

Red Sand Market and Deli is a casual neighborhood spot that combines a mini-mart with a deli, offering a range of options from snacks and drinks to made-to-order food. The deli menu features creative sandwiches, salads, burgers, and hot dogs, with the "best chicken sandwich" and tuna melt receiving high praise for their quality and fresh ingredients. The chop chop crunch salad is also a standout item, noted for its fresh ingredients and flavorful dressing. Customers have generally lauded the friendly service and fast preparation, creating a welcoming, family-like atmosphere. Though primarily a to-go establishment, there are plans to add tables for on-site dining.

Esa's Cafe is a casual breakfast and brunch spot known for its hearty portions and diverse menu with California and Mexican influences. The restaurant has a laid-back, surfer-themed atmosphere. Popular dishes include the Bacado Omelette, Roasted Pasillo Chile Relleno Omelette, Eggs Benedict, and wheat germ blueberry pancakes, with some reviewers specifically praising the homemade sauces and jams. While most reviewers find the food satisfying, some have noted that the coffee is not up to par. Service experiences vary, with some customers reporting slow or inattentive service. The cafe also accommodates dogs on its patio and has a special early bird breakfast deal.

Somerset offers a mixed experience, defined by its upscale and modern ambiance, particularly its attractive patio, though some find the decor pretentious and out of place. While some reviewers rave about the delicious cocktails and beautifully presented entrees like the spaghetti with lobster bisque and seared scallops, others criticize the food quality, portion sizes, and high prices. Service experiences vary widely, with some praising attentive staff, while others report slow, condescending, or negligent service. A few reviewers mention issues with over-salted food and tap water quality. Despite its potential, Somerset's inconsistency in food, service, and value leaves a somewhat underwhelming impression for many diners.

Secret Bao is a popular Asian fusion restaurant known for its innovative dishes and high-quality ingredients, now located in a cozy and modern space with both indoor and outdoor seating. The atmosphere is casual and trendy, making it a fun place to try unique menu items like the highly recommended KFC bao, mushroom bao, and udon carbonara, with the shrimp bao also receiving high praise. While some reviewers find certain dishes, like the dumplings and pork belly bao, less impressive, the overall quality of the food and friendly service make it a recurring spot for many, with a focus on creative flavor combinations and well-executed dishes, though some find the prices a bit high for the portion sizes. The restaurant is also praised for its unique and well-maintained aesthetic.

Santo Mezcal offers a trendy and classy atmosphere with a casual vibe, making it suitable for various occasions. The restaurant is known for its creative and refreshing Mexican fare and cocktails, with some specialty drinks being so popular that they occasionally run out. The menu features unique, regional Mexican flavors, with standout dishes including the Seafood Tostada, Halibut Tacos, Chicken Mole Negro, and Octopus Ceviche, while the Salmon Tropical and crab enchiladas receive frequent praise. While most reviewers rave about the food quality and creative cocktails, some find the food overpriced and occasionally inconsistent, with some dishes erring on the bland side or overly reliant on sweet sauces. Though service is generally attentive and friendly, there are some reports of slow or disorganized service, particularly when the restaurant is busy.

Aldo's Italian Restaurant offers a mixed experience, with an ambiance that many find romantic and cozy, especially on the outdoor patio, though some find the indoor seating cramped and noisy. While some diners praise specific dishes like the crab cakes, scallops, eggplant genovese, and certain pasta dishes, others criticize the food as mediocre, bland, or even poorly prepared, citing issues like stale bread, microwaved lasagna, and flavorless sauces. Service quality appears inconsistent, with reports ranging from friendly and accommodating to slow, inattentive, or even rude, and some customers have noted extra charges and mandatory gratuity. Despite some positive reviews, a significant number of diners express disappointment, describing the restaurant as a tourist trap with overpriced and underwhelming food.

Lilly's Tacos is a casual Mexican eatery known for its authentic street tacos, serving a wide variety of meat options, from traditional carne asada and marinated pork to more adventurous choices like beef tongue, cheek, and even eyeball. The tacos are simply prepared with meat and tortillas, allowing customers to customize their orders with fresh toppings from the salsa bar, including cilantro, onions, radishes, and various salsas. While some reviewers find the food to be inconsistent, with occasional dryness in the meat, the majority praise the generous portions, flavorful options, and affordable prices, making it a popular spot among locals and tourists alike. The restaurant maintains a fast and efficient service, despite often having a line out the door.

Las Aves Cafe is a casual Mexican restaurant that offers a pleasant dining experience with good service. It's located in the Best Western, which is not necessarily a bad thing since parking is not an issue. It is known for its strong drinks and generous portions at reasonable prices. The shrimp chile relleno is a standout dish, with customers raving about the sauce, and the fish tacos and spinach fish salad are also popular. Other recommended dishes include the chicken alambre, the guacamole, and the strawberry cheesecake. While the ribeye and lamb shank have received less favorable reviews, the restaurant generally delivers well-prepared and beautifully presented meals. The staff are noted for their friendliness and attentiveness.

The Roundhouse, located in a resort, offers a convenient dining option but receives mixed reviews. The restaurant is known for its slow service, with multiple reviewers noting long wait times and inattentive staff. While the breakfast buffet is well-presented with a decent selection, the food quality is inconsistent, with some dishes like the spicy tuna melt and chilaquiles receiving praise, while others are described as tasteless. Despite a pleasant environment and polite staff, the slow service and high prices make it a questionable choice unless convenience is a top priority.

Holdren's Steaks & Seafood in Santa Barbara offers a classy yet casual dining experience with a focus on quality steaks and seafood. The restaurant boasts a lively atmosphere, especially during happy hour, and provides both indoor and outdoor seating. Highly praised menu items include the filet mignon, ribeye, and cowboy cut steaks, often enhanced with the popular Rosemary Blue Cheese sauce. The sea bass, bacon-wrapped scallops, and various daily specials also receive positive mentions, with some customers singling out the coconut shrimp and mud pie for their exceptional flavors. While the food quality is generally lauded, some reviews point out inconsistencies in steak preparation, occasional slow service, and dishes that didn't quite meet expectations, such as the mac and cheese. Overall, Holdren's is known for its attentive service, extensive wine list, and generous portions, making it a popular spot for both locals and visitors seeking a classic steakhouse experience.

Cali-Forno Pizzeria is known for its outstanding, wood-fired pizza, particularly the popular Chipotle Chicken pizza, made with fresh ingredients and a delicious sauce on a perfect crust. The pizzeria has friendly staff, with one owner being particularly helpful and personable. The atmosphere and location add to the positive experience, making it a worthwhile destination for pizza lovers.

Golden Line Coffee Bar, a pop-up coffee shop located inside Villa Wine Bar, offers a unique and relaxed experience. Known for its high-quality, ethically sourced Equator Coffee and handmade beverages, the coffee bar takes pride in its meticulous preparation methods, using precise temperature control and grind sizes. Customers rave about the smooth Mocha Java blend, flavorful vanilla lattes made with fresh vanilla bean pods, and creative concoctions like the cacao-infused chai iced latte. The bar also serves pastries from Bree'osh. The atmosphere is described as unhurried and welcoming, making it a perfect spot to savor a thoughtfully crafted coffee drink.

Choppa Poke offers a diverse menu featuring both poke bowls and rolled ice cream, providing a unique dining experience with fresh ingredients. Customers have praised the freshness of the fish in the poke bowls, particularly the tuna and salmon, and the wide variety of sauces and toppings available. The imitation crab stands out as a unique and flavorful addition. On the ice cream side, the rolled ice cream with Asian-inspired toppings like matcha and taro is a must-try, with the "Monkey Business" combination being a popular choice. While most reviewers laud the quality and service, some have noted issues with employee knowledge and occasional inconsistencies in service and food quality, as well as rising prices.

Winchell's Donuts is a classic donut shop known for its affordable prices and round-the-clock service. While the location may not be the most appealing, customers rave about their apple fritters and old-fashioned donuts, especially the ones with chocolate topping, though some find the quality of the old-fashioned donuts inconsistent. The mini donut holes are a definite highlight. The atmosphere evokes a sense of nostalgia, and the staff is often cheerful and friendly.

Tamira is a well-regarded Indian restaurant located in downtown Santa Barbara, offering a casual and classy ambiance. The restaurant is known for its affordable prices, especially the lunch buffet, which features a variety of tasty dishes, including chicken tikka masala and flavorful naan. Customers consistently praise the excellent and attentive service, noting the friendly owners and staff. While some reviewers find the food average or inconsistent, many rave about the authentic flavors and high quality, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists seeking Indian cuisine.

South Coast Deli on Carrillo Street is a casual spot known for its generously sized sandwiches and salads, often large enough to share or save for a second meal. The restaurant is praised for its fresh ingredients and diverse menu, with popular items like the Chicken Chipotle Club, Buffalo Chicken Sammy, and various salads like the Asian Greens and Mexican Caesar. Customers appreciate the quick service, online ordering, and friendly staff, with special mentions for the breakfast panini and tri-tip sandwich. The deli also caters to different dietary needs with gluten-free and vegetarian/vegan options available, making it a reliable choice for a satisfying and customizable meal.

Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant offers a charming and popular spot for breakfast and brunch, known for its lively atmosphere, including live jazz on Sundays, and outdoor patio seating. While the ordering system can be confusing and the prices are a bit high, the quality of the food and service are generally praised. Popular menu items include the banana kahlua French toast, eggs Benedict (particularly the lobster and Norwegian variations), and lemon poppyseed pancakes. Despite some inconsistencies in service and occasional issues with specific dishes, Jeannine's is often recommended for its delicious food, great coffee (Peet's), and convenient downtown location.

Haggen Food & Pharmacy in Santa Barbara has received mixed reviews, primarily noting its higher prices compared to its predecessor, Albertsons. While some appreciate the store's cleanliness, ample parking, and potential for finding good deals, others have criticized the bare shelves and increased costs. Some customers have reported negative experiences with the service, including accusations of theft and a perceived lack of attentiveness from cashiers. The transition from Albertsons has not been well-received by all, with some finding the store to be a disappointing replacement.

Ana's Taco Bar is a casual, late-night Mexican spot located in the heart of the State Street bar scene. While opinions vary, it's known for being a place to grab a quick bite, especially after a night out. Some reviewers praise the fish tacos and carne asada fries, while others criticize the bland meat and high prices, particularly for items like the California burrito. The service quality seems inconsistent, with some customers experiencing long wait times and order errors. Despite the mixed reviews, the happy hour deals and convenient location make it a popular option for some looking for a fast and accessible meal.

Cantwell's Market & Deli is a casual spot with a deli that offers a variety of sandwiches and salads. While the location is convenient and the market has a decent selection of wine, beer, and gourmet items, it tends to be pricey, with some items being significantly marked up compared to other stores. The quality of the food and service appears inconsistent, with some customers praising the breakfast burritos and cheesesteaks, while others complain about stale ingredients, skimpy portions, and rude staff. Some reviewers also mention a decline in quality and service under new management, with issues like expired products, dirty conditions, and a lack of customer service.

Santa Barbara Fish Market is a casual seafood market located in the harbor that offers a wide selection of fresh seafood. The market is particularly known for its fresh sea urchin (uni) and oysters, with the uni being a customer favorite and often selling out quickly. Customers can purchase seafood to take home and prepare, or have the staff shuck oysters and crack open sea urchins for immediate consumption. The market also offers items like poke, sashimi, and salads, though the quality of these items can be inconsistent. While the market is generally praised for its fresh, high-quality seafood and reasonable prices, some customers have reported slow or rude service, and occasional issues with the freshness and preparation of certain items. The market is a popular spot for both locals and tourists looking for fresh seafood, and offers student discounts.

Sublime is an American (New) restaurant that garnered mixed reviews before its closure. While some appreciated the friendly service and a few dishes like the sage chicken and pork sliders, many customers criticized the high prices, subpar food quality, and confused menu. The ambiance was described as sterile, and the service was often slow and clueless. Common complaints included the use of bagged chips for nachos, pre-frozen ingredients, and dishes that tasted like they came from a "church potluck". The lack of branding, web presence, and an established identity were also noted as significant drawbacks, with many feeling that the restaurant failed to live up to its potential despite its promising location.

Arigato Sushi is a popular and classy sushi restaurant in Santa Barbara known for its extensive menu and fresh fish, though it can be pricey. The restaurant has a lively atmosphere and offers both indoor and outdoor seating. While some reviewers praise specific rolls like the Magic Mushroom and Blue Man, along with the jalapeño yellowtail and the chef's special rolls, others find the rolls small and the quality inconsistent. Some patrons recommend sitting at the sushi bar for a better experience. Overall, while the quality of the sushi is generally well-regarded, Arigato Sushi can be noisy and crowded, and customers should be prepared for a wait and a higher price point.

Petrini's Italian Restaurant in Santa Barbara offers a casual, family-friendly dining experience with a classic old-school Italian atmosphere, complete with red and white checkered tablecloths. The restaurant is known for its generous portions and affordable prices, serving up traditional American-Italian dishes. While some reviewers praise specific items like Manny's Linguini, garlic bread, lasagna, chicken piccata, and thin-crust pizza, others have criticized the pizza and marinara sauce for lacking flavor. The service is generally considered friendly and welcoming, although it can be inconsistent. Notable features include the homemade salad dressing and a comfortable, unpretentious vibe that appeals to locals and families.

Sushi Cafe is a casual, no-frills spot that offers sushi and poke bowls.
