Despite the mixed reviews, Farmer Boy has been a local establishment for many years, suggesting it maintains a loyal customer base seeking a classic diner experience.

Broad Street Oyster Company is a seafood vendor known for its fresh, high-quality offerings and fun, social atmosphere. It's often set up at Municipal Winery, creating a unique experience where customers can enjoy their seafood with local wines. The lobster roll is a standout item, featuring generous portions of fresh Maine lobster meat served on a buttery, toasted roll, and the uni and oysters are also highly praised for their freshness, with the uni often sourced locally. The owner, Chris, is frequently mentioned for his dedication to quality and engaging personality, creating a memorable dining experience.

The Four Seasons Resort The Biltmore Santa Barbara offers an upscale and classy experience with its Spanish-style architecture, lush gardens, and ocean views. Guests rave about the impeccable service, from the valet to the housekeeping staff. The resort is praised for its beautiful location across from the beach and its overall atmosphere of tranquility. While the food quality receives mixed reviews, the Sunday brunch is often mentioned as a highlight, though pricey. A point of note is that some guests feel some of the features are worn, and some rooms can be noisy due to thin walls or train proximity. Guests also have access to the Coral Casino Beach and Cabana Club across the street, featuring a pool and oceanfront amenities.

Eller's Doughnut House & Bakery is a unique establishment that combines a donut shop with Thai food and a small selection of Asian goods. While opinions on the donuts vary, with some praising the glazed buttermilk bars and fresh taste, others find them average or stale. A surprising highlight is the Thai food, particularly the panang curry and pad see ew, though the quality can be inconsistent depending on who's cooking, and some reviewers have found it to be average. Service is a significant point of contention, with numerous complaints about rude, inattentive staff and long wait times, though some customers have experienced friendly service. Despite mixed reviews, the novelty of the combination and the occasional free donut holes keep some customers returning.

Goat Tree is a trendy cafe with a relaxed atmosphere, offering both indoor and outdoor patio seating near the beach. While the ambiance and location are often praised, the restaurant receives mixed reviews regarding service and food quality. Some patrons have reported slow, inattentive, and sometimes rude service, with issues like long wait times, understaffing, and disorganized staff. The food quality also varies, with some dishes like the avocado toast, salmon toast, and fries receiving positive feedback, while others, like the turkey sandwich and certain pastries, are criticized for being overpriced or of poor quality. Despite the inconsistencies, the cafe is appreciated for its dog-friendly policy, happy hour, and potential for people-watching, though the prices are generally considered high.

Viva Modern Mexican, formerly known as Cielito, is located in the charming La Arcada Plaza in downtown Santa Barbara and offers a unique twist on Mexican cuisine with a modern and upscale vibe. The restaurant has a beautiful setting, including a lovely outdoor patio with a fountain and live turtles, creating a relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere. While some found the service to be inconsistent and occasionally slow, others have raved about the attentive and friendly staff. The menu features a variety of tapas-style dishes, such as the highly recommended pork belly quesadilla, as well as seafood entrees and a unique blackberry margarita. While opinions on the food quality vary, with some praising the innovative flavors and others finding it mediocre and overpriced, the restaurant is generally appreciated for its ambiance and atmosphere.

The Boathouse at Hendry's Beach is a popular spot in Santa Barbara, prized for its beautiful beachside location offering stunning ocean views. The atmosphere is casual yet upscale, making it suitable for dates and family outings. The food generally receives positive feedback, with specific dishes like the crab cakes Benedict, seafood pasta, and cioppino being frequently praised, but some reviewers note inconsistencies in food quality. There is also a diverse happy hour menu with tasty and fresh seafood options. Service quality varies, with some customers reporting attentive and friendly staff, while others mention slow or inattentive service. A great spot to have a drink or enjoy a meal with a view or see the sunset, its popularity means long waits are common.

Tupelo Junction Cafe offers a Southern-inspired menu with a casual, charming ambiance that family and friend groups can enjoy. While the restaurant can get busy, especially on weekends, its happy hour is popular for offering discounted dishes and cocktails. The menu has some highly recommended dishes such as the Dungeness crab cake with potato hash, the french toast made from baguettes, and the spicy smoked chipotle and crab Bloody Mary, which includes a crab claw and pickled green beans. Some customers have reported issues with cold food and inconsistent service.

Yanni's Greek & American Deli is a casual, hole-in-the-wall spot that offers a unique dining experience with friendly service. While its exterior and interior might appear run-down and cluttered, don't let the looks fool you. The restaurant is well-known for its gyros and tri-tip sandwiches, with many reviewers claiming they are the best in town. The Greek food is praised for being authentic and flavorful, with fresh ingredients and generous portions. Despite some criticisms about the atmosphere and occasional inconsistencies in food quality, the owner's warm demeanor and the delicious food make it a worthwhile visit for those seeking a tasty and unpretentious meal.

South Coast Deli - Chapala is a popular spot known for its large portions and diverse menu of creative sandwiches and salads. The restaurant has a casual atmosphere, offering both indoor and outdoor seating. Customer favorites include the chicken pesto panini, the Cobb salad, and the South Coast Turkey sandwich, though some find the sandwiches can be heavy on sauces like mayo and dressings. While the quality of the food is generally praised, some customers have noted inconsistencies in portion sizes and occasional issues with service, especially during the busy lunch hours. Despite these minor drawbacks, the deli is appreciated for its fresh ingredients and friendly staff, making it a go-to place for a satisfying lunch.

The Creekside Restaurant & Bar has a casual, family-friendly vibe with a spacious outdoor patio featuring games for kids like ping pong and cornhole. The menu focuses on American cuisine, with barbecue items like tri-tip and ribs being popular, though some found the quality inconsistent. The French dip, fries and candied bacon also receive positive mentions. Some reviewers have noted the service can be slow or disorganized, while others praise the friendly and attentive staff. The atmosphere can get noisy, especially with children playing or during events like line dancing.

The Daisy Restaurant in Santa Barbara is a trendy spot known for its fresh, flavorful dishes and inviting atmosphere. The restaurant has a clean, modern decor. The menu features a variety of options, including standouts like the mezze plate (with beet muhammara, hummus, and flatbread), falafel, and house-smoked prawns, with many vegetarian and vegan options available. The quality of the ingredients is emphasized, with a focus on local and farmer's market produce. While most reviewers praise the food and find the staff friendly and attentive, some have noted inconsistencies in service and portion sizes, or an odd flavor profile in some items. The restaurant also features wine on tap and homemade bread, adding to its unique appeal.

Jade Restaurant is a small, intimate Asian fusion eatery that aims to offer a creative menu with locally sourced food. While some diners praise dishes like the coconut milk soup, pulled pork with snap peas and polenta, Asian pot stickers, and passion fruit creme brulee, others have found the food to be inconsistent, with criticisms directed towards bland or overly salty dishes like the fish and chow mein, as well as the sometimes dry ribs. The service quality also appears variable, ranging from attentive and friendly to absent-minded or even rude, with occasional complaints about slow service or servers being inattentive. The ambiance is generally described as quiet and minimalist, though the restaurant's exterior may not immediately convey its upscale aspirations.

Sevilla is a swanky, upscale restaurant and lounge with a modern and chic ambiance, featuring dark, romantic decor. The restaurant has a diverse menu, with seafood dishes and tapas being particularly well-regarded, especially the "mac & cheese," which is gnocchi with manchego cheese sauce and truffle oil. The presentation of the food is praised as beautiful and "Top Chef" style. The service is generally considered great, with bartenders offering helpful suggestions. A unique aspect of the restaurant is its co-ed bathrooms with full-length mirrors, which some find intriguing and fun.

Savoy Cafe & Deli is a charming, health-conscious spot with a welcoming atmosphere, offering a wide variety of organic and gluten-free options. The restaurant is known for its fresh, high-quality ingredients and flavorful dishes, including the popular salad bar, eggs Benedict, vegan burrito, and gluten-free flapjacks. Guy Fieri's featured turkey fritter and carrot cake are also highly recommended. The service is generally friendly and attentive, contributing to the cozy and family-owned vibe, although the restaurant can get crowded, especially during lunch hours. The deli-style setup includes a salad bar, hot food station, and a sandwich board, catering to diverse tastes and dietary needs.

Blackbird offers a mixed experience with its upscale and classy atmosphere inspired by Hitchcock, though some find it dark and uncomfortable. While some reviewers praise the food, creative cocktails, and exceptional service, especially highlighting the lobster claw appetizer, grilled octopus, and unique desserts like the avocado dessert and 70% chocolate dessert, others criticize the high prices, small entree portions, and inconsistent food quality, with dishes sometimes being too salty or lacking flavor. Service can be inconsistent, ranging from attentive and professional to slow and disorganized, and the restaurant can be noisy. Unique aspects include its happy hour, dog-friendly policy, and location within the Hotel Californian, with live music on Saturdays.

Hoffmann Brat Haus is a lively spot known for its German and Belgian beers and variety of bratwurst, located in downtown Santa Barbara with a fun atmosphere, especially on the upstairs balcony overlooking State Street. The restaurant offers a range of traditional and exotic sausages, with the rattlesnake and rabbit brat being a popular choice, alongside Belgian fries with an array of dipping sauces like rosemary aioli and chipotle aioli. While many praise the unique beer selection and tasty food, some customers have noted inconsistent service, occasional issues with cleanliness, and a slightly high price point. Despite mixed opinions, the restaurant is a popular destination for those seeking a casual spot to enjoy brats, beer, and people-watching.

Via Maestra 42 is a cozy, authentic Italian restaurant with a deli atmosphere that offers a diverse menu of Italian cuisine and is known as a local hidden gem. The restaurant's vibe is casual and charming, reminiscent of a small Italian café, making it suitable for dates, family meals, and gatherings with friends. The food receives high praise, with standout dishes like the spinach and pumpkin ravioli, lasagna, and squid ink pasta, accompanied by authentic sauces and fresh ingredients; desserts such as gelato and the chocolate puff are also highly recommended. While some reviewers mention occasional issues with portion sizes and service consistency, the overall consensus highlights the friendly staff, the quality of the food, and the unique, intimate dining experience that sets it apart from other Italian restaurants in the area.

Shang Hai is a long-standing Chinese restaurant in Santa Barbara, known for its consistently good, Americanized Chinese cuisine and friendly service. The restaurant has a cozy, clean ambiance with low-key decor, despite its unassuming location in a strip mall. Shang Hai is particularly praised for its extensive vegetarian and vegan menu, featuring dishes like vegan lemon chicken, soy chicken, and mushroom egg foo young, alongside traditional favorites such as orange chicken, sizzling rice soup, and chow mein. Many reviewers highlight the fresh ingredients, flavorful sauces, and generous portions, as well as the attentive service provided by the family-run business, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

Cubaneo is a popular Cuban spot known for its vibrant atmosphere with tropical decor, lively ambiance, and shared space with a cocktail bar and brewery. The restaurant is particularly praised for its Cuban sandwiches, especially the #2 Cubano and Medianoche, featuring flavorful pork roast and crispy bread, though some find them small for the price. Other popular dishes include the Ropa Nueva, Plato Mixto, and Yucca fries, with the black beans receiving mixed reviews. The service is generally friendly, and the restaurant is a great spot for a casual meal or a late-night bite, offering happy hour deals and staying open late.

Finestra Cafe is a local coffee shop and cafe that may be closed since July of this year but might reopen as a Jeaninne's Bakery. It offers a quintessential Central Coast cafe experience with convenient service for quick coffee runs, as well as cafe seating for longer visits and books for purchase. The menu includes breakfast items like the highly recommended California Scramble, which is a great value with meat, veggies, and fluffy eggs served over home fries, as well as burgers, hot and cold sandwiches, quiche, quesadillas, soups, and salads. Known for being busiest during breakfast and lunch, it's a great alternative to chain coffee shops.

Hook and Press Donuts is a popular spot known for its creative and seasonal donut flavors, offering a gourmet twist on the classic treat, with some even made for dogs. The donuts are praised for their unique and well-balanced flavor combinations, like the POG (passion fruit, orange, and guava) and Browned Butter, and their beautiful, artful presentation. The shop shares space with other businesses creating a bustling, hip atmosphere that's popular among cyclists, hipsters, and those looking for a unique experience. While some find the donuts a bit pricey and occasionally dense, the friendly staff and high-quality ingredients keep customers coming back for a special indulgence.

Lilsy Wood Fired Pizza is a local pizzeria known for its New York-style, wood-fired pizzas with a crispy yet chewy crust and a tangy, flavorful sauce. The restaurant is praised for its high-quality ingredients, generous toppings, and fresh preparation, with some reviewers noting it's the closest they've found to true NY pizza. The owner and staff are often described as friendly and accommodating, contributing to a welcoming atmosphere. The restaurant offers both whole pies and slices, along with lunch specials and sides like hot wings, pesto twists, and fries, although some customers have noted inconsistencies in the quality of the fries. While the interior is small, the overall experience makes it a worthwhile stop for pizza lovers.

Kyoto is a long-standing Japanese restaurant known for its fun, casual atmosphere and reasonable prices. While some find the decor a bit dated, the restaurant offers unique features like tatami rooms for a more traditional dining experience. The menu is extensive, with a wide variety of sushi rolls, including popular choices like the 3-Moon Roll, 911 Roll, and Firecracker Roll, as well as teriyaki and noodle dishes. The quality of the food receives mixed reviews, with some praising the freshness and flavor, while others find it mediocre. Service can also be inconsistent, with some reviewers noting friendly and fast service, while others have experienced slow or inattentive staff. During peak hours, it can get crowded and noisy, especially with sake-bombing parties.

Blue Tavern offers a chic casual island ambiance with a lively atmosphere. The menu features American (New) and Peruvian-inspired dishes, with standout items like the seafood risotto, cauliflower, miso tofu soup, and creative pizzas. Many reviewers praise the inventive and flavorful food, noting the freshness of the ingredients. The bar program is a highlight, with creative cocktails and mocktails crafted by talented bartenders. While some reviewers have mentioned slow or inattentive service, most commend the excellent and knowledgeable staff. The restaurant can be a bit pricey, but many feel the quality of the food and drinks justifies the cost.

Located in Santa Barbara, Trattoria Mollie offers a mixed experience with its Italian cuisine in a classy and romantic setting. While some reviewers praise the food, particularly the salmon in pink sauce, lobster pasta, Margherita pizza, and the turkey meatballs, others find the dishes to be average, overpriced, and with small portions. The service quality appears inconsistent, with some customers reporting fantastic service and a personable owner, while others describe it as horrible, cold, and inattentive. Some reviewers have also mentioned issues with the staff's brusque attitude and slow service. Despite these mixed reviews, the restaurant has been a favorite of locals and celebrities alike.

Globe is a restaurant and bar with a warm, inviting, and eclectic atmosphere, featuring internationally-influenced decor and cozy lounge areas. The menu offers a variety of small plates with global flavors, with the blackened filet bites and sweet corn cakes being highly recommended. However, some reviewers have noted inconsistencies in food quality and portion sizes, as well as mixed experiences with the service, with some bartenders being criticized for rudeness and inability to make certain drinks. Despite these drawbacks, many patrons praise the unique vibe and recommend it as a spot for drinks and sharing small plates with friends.

Boondocks, formerly known as Creekside, attempts to offer a slightly more upscale experience but the atmosphere is lacking significant improvement. While some appreciate the changes and reasonable prices, others find the drink prices high for what you get. The quality of the food receives mixed reviews, with some finding it really good, while others criticize it. Service is inconsistent, with reports of unprofessional behavior from some staff members. The restaurant has faced challenges, including a closure where employees were allegedly not informed.

Rice Garden is a fast-food Chinese restaurant near UCSB known for its speed and value. Although one reviewer considers it a "hidden gem," another laments that the quality and variety have declined from the previous year when it offered authentic-tasting dishes like curry chicken. Regulars praise specific menu items such as the chow mein and orange chicken. Its location offers a view of the beach, and it is considered superior to Panda Express.

The Santa Barbara Harbor & Seafood Festival is a lively, free-admission event held annually in October, celebrated for its fresh seafood and harbor atmosphere. Though often crowded, it offers a variety of seafood options like lobster, crab, oysters, and the highly praised fresh sea urchin (uni) at affordable prices. Visitors can purchase live seafood and have it cooked on-site, though wait times can be lengthy. The festival includes live music, craft vendors, and activities like boat rides, creating a fun environment for families and seafood enthusiasts. While some find the food overpriced and the lines long, many highlight the quality of the seafood and the overall festive vibe.

The Santa Barbara Public Market offers a trendy, casual, and industrial-style atmosphere with a variety of vendors, although some find it small and pricey. Praised for its cleanliness and modern vibe, it features a mix of high-quality restaurants and vendors, including pasta, seafood, Thai noodles, Mexican cuisine, and artisanal ice cream and cupcakes, as well as wine and beer. The market is considered a great spot for lunch and quick bites, and it's a popular choice for groups since everyone can find something to enjoy, though some reviewers find the food underwhelming and the prices high. Additional features include underground parking, outdoor seating, and a kitchen available for rent.

Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill offers a casual sports bar atmosphere with numerous TVs, making it a great place to watch games. The restaurant is known for its BBQ, with the ribs and brisket receiving praise from some customers, while others find the food bland or average. There are many options for sauces, and some customers appreciate the happy hour deals, especially the wings, sliders, and beer specials. The service quality seems inconsistent, with some reviewers mentioning great service while others report slow or inattentive staff, and there are mixed opinions on the value and portion sizes.

Loquita is a trendy and classy Spanish tapas restaurant with a lively atmosphere, offering both indoor and outdoor seating, including a dog-friendly patio. The restaurant specializes in Spanish cuisine, with a focus on tapas and paella, and is known for its great food, service, and vibe. Highly recommended dishes include the Pulpo (octopus), Croquetas de Pollo, Vaca (hanger steak), and Mariscos Paella, with the churros being a must-try dessert. The drink menu features a variety of gin and tonics and an extensive Spanish wine list, though some find the cocktails to be inconsistent. While some reviewers find the prices high for the portion sizes and report mixed experiences with the service, the overall consensus is that Loquita provides a memorable dining experience with authentic and flavorful Spanish dishes.

Verdé is a Spanish, Tex-Mex, and American restaurant with a classy ambiance and a lively atmosphere, featuring happy hour and balcony views of State Street. While the location and ambiance are appreciated, reviews indicate that the food and service quality can be inconsistent. Some diners have criticized the food as bland, overpriced, and slow to arrive, with drinks being weak and watered down. Others have found the food to be good but not outstanding, with a lack of expected spiciness in dishes featuring Hatch chilis. The service has also been described as slow and unhelpful, with servers lacking knowledge of the menu. However, the chef is considered cool and serious about food, and some have had positive experiences with the staff.

Mesa Verde is a vegetarian restaurant with numerous vegan options that offers a unique dining experience, characterized by its artful presentation and flavorful, healthy dishes. The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting, with a rustic-chic decor. Standout menu items include the polenta fries, mushroom tacos, empanadas, macro bowl, flatbreads, and baklava, all praised for their creative combinations of spices and fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The restaurant is known for its excellent customer service and friendly staff, with many reviewers highlighting the owner's personal touch and attentiveness. While some found the prices high for the portion sizes, most agree that the quality and unique flavor profiles make it a worthwhile visit, even for non-vegetarians.

Vices & Spices From Around the World is a unique spot that combines a coffee and tea shop with a gift shop vibe, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. Customers rave about the extensive selection of teas, coffees, and spices, with particular praise for the Obama blend and coconut pouchong tea. The shop also offers a variety of gifts, including jewelry, scarves, and cards, making it a great place to find unique presents. While most reviewers compliment the friendly staff, some have noted inconsistent service, with a few experiences of unfriendly or unwelcoming employees. The lack of Wi-Fi encourages conversation and board games, adding to the relaxed, community-focused ambiance.

Spiritland Bistro in Santa Barbara offers a unique dining experience with a focus on local, organic ingredients and boundary-free dishes. The atmosphere is generally cozy and unpretentious, suitable for a range of diners. The restaurant is known for its vegetarian and vegan options, including raw dishes, with flexibility in accommodating dietary restrictions. While some reviewers have praised the food quality, especially the salads, polenta appetizer, and raw zucchini lasagna, others have found the fish overcooked or the service inconsistent. Notable dishes include the five-element miso soup, cucumber salad, and honey-lavender crème brûlée.

Back Door Deli is a hidden gem that supports the Community Action Commission. The restaurant has a cafeteria-style setting but offers an impressive selection of made-to-order items. The breakfast burritos are a highlight, with the turkey breakfast burrito being a standout. The Adobo Chicken sandwich and Jalapeno burger are also flavorful and well-received. Prices are relatively low for the area, and the staff is friendly. While there may be a bit of a wait during busy times, the food is worth it.

Yellow Belly is a casual, neighborhood gastropub with a cozy and inviting atmosphere, offering both indoor and outdoor seating, including dog-friendly patios. The restaurant is known for its diverse menu of elevated American comfort food, with highly recommended items like the fried chicken sandwich, Brussels sprouts, garlic parmesan fries, and Black and Bleu burger, though some reviewers have noted inconsistencies in food quality and preparation. While most praise the attentive and friendly service, some have reported slow or inattentive service, especially during busy periods. The restaurant also features a solid craft beer selection, happy hour specials, and live music, making it a popular spot for locals and visitors alike.

Santa Barbara Wine Spa offers a unique experience that combines relaxation with wine. The atmosphere is generally described as calming, welcoming, and clean, with interesting decor, though some found it small and cramped. Massages are often praised for being professional and effective, particularly deep tissue massages, with some therapists like Scott and Lauryn receiving high recommendations. However, there are significant concerns about customer service, including difficulties in booking appointments, unreturned calls, and reports of unprofessional behavior from the staff and owners. Many customers have complained about feeling rushed, dealing with hard-sell tactics for massage packages, and issues with Groupon vouchers not being honored. The inconsistency in service and reports of unethical practices create a mixed experience, with some customers loving it and others feeling ripped off.

Wabi Sabi, located in the Santa Barbara Public Market, is a sushi bar known for its fresh, high-quality fish and creative rolls. The atmosphere is casual and hipster, with seating available in the Public Market. Highly praised menu items include the Crispy Kama, Chu Toro, Bluefin Tuna, Scampi Tempura Roll, and the Don't Cry Roll, known for its unique Thai chili and cilantro twist. The restaurant is also noted for its flavorful spicy mayo, fresh wasabi and ginger, and expertly prepared sushi rice. While some find the prices a bit high for a counter-service establishment and note the small size of some rolls, the overall quality and freshness of the sushi, along with friendly service, make it a popular choice.

iGrill Korean BBQ is a casual restaurant offering an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ experience, though some diners find the authenticity and quality don't quite compare to KBBQ in Los Angeles. The atmosphere is generally considered good, especially after new management took over, with friendly service, although some reviewers have reported disorganized or inattentive service. The menu includes grill-your-own BBQ items, with the pork belly often cited as a standout, alongside traditional side dishes (banchan) with free refills; however, some diners have criticized the meat quality and flavor, while others praise the freshness and variety. A few customers have complained about issues with leftovers and associated charges, as well as the restaurant's temperature.

Billies, now under new ownership and called Mamma Donna's, offers a unique diner experience with a retro garage vibe, complete with vintage pinball machines and 80s album covers adorning the walls. The restaurant is known for its from-scratch approach to diner food, including house-ground beef burgers, homemade ketchup, and chili made with chunks of tender pork shoulder. Sweet potato fries with chipotle mayo are a popular, shareable item. They also serve tasty mac and cheese combined with their chili. It's praised for its sociable atmosphere and late-night service, along with happy hour deals.

Panda Express is a fast-food Chinese restaurant that receives mixed reviews. While some customers appreciate the affordability and quick service, others have reported issues with food quality, portion sizes, and customer service. Some reviewers have had positive experiences with friendly staff and fresh food, while others have complained about slow and sloppy service, rude employees, and inconsistent food preparation, such as raw noodles or skimpy portions. The restaurant's location in the Paseo Nuevo outdoor mall is convenient for some, but the overall consensus suggests that the quality of food and service can be inconsistent and unreliable.

Taco Bell on N Milpas Street is a casual fast-food spot that receives mixed reviews. While some customers praise the accurate and fast orders, friendly service, and the nostalgic feel of the original brick building, others have been disappointed with the food's flavor and portion sizes. The Cheesy Gordita Crunch is a popular item, and the location sometimes offers the "Green Sauce." However, some reviewers have mentioned issues with the bathroom's cleanliness, early closures, and inconsistent food quality compared to advertised images, and an incident with employees threatening to call the police on customers eating in their car in the parking lot.

Noemi Pizza Romana is highly praised for its unique Roman-style pizza, characterized by a thick, light, and airy crust achieved through a 96-hour fermentation process, setting it apart from typical Neapolitan pizzas. The restaurant offers a variety of specialty pizzas, including the popular Soppressata and Great White, with fresh, high-quality toppings, as well as calzones. Customers appreciate the generous portion sizes, reasonable prices, and the option to buy pizza by the slice, with a lunch special available. While the wait times can be long, especially on weekends, and seating is limited to a small patio, the friendly staff and exceptional pizza make it a worthwhile experience.

Piano Gastrolounge is a restaurant with a mixed reputation, offering an overall rustic yet classy atmosphere with quirky artwork and a notable piano. While some patrons rave about dishes like the Local Halibut, short rib panini, and macaroni and cheese, others have criticized the food quality, citing issues such as burnt burgers, bland entrees like the Duck Croquettes, and subpar tomato bisque. Service experiences also vary widely, with some customers praising the attentive staff and others reporting slow or inattentive service. Despite some positive aspects like happy hour deals and a pleasant patio setting, inconsistent food quality and service raise concerns about whether it can stand the test of time in Santa Barbara's competitive restaurant scene.

Mesa Burger in Santa Barbara is a casual yet stylish burger joint known for its gourmet burgers and beachy vibe. While some find it pricey, many customers praise the high-quality ingredients and creative burger combinations, such as the Montecito and Funk Zone burgers, with vegetarian options also receiving acclaim. The herb truffle and parmesan fries are a standout side dish, though opinions on the regular and sweet potato fries are mixed. The service is generally friendly and efficient, but occasional inconsistencies have been reported. The restaurant offers both indoor and outdoor seating, with a generally relaxed atmosphere.

Convivo Restaurant and Bar offers a classy, ocean-side dining experience with good food and a lively ambiance. The restaurant is known for its happy hour, which includes food and drink specials. The service quality can be inconsistent, with some reviewers praising the attentive staff and others mentioning slow or inattentive service. Many customers rave about specific menu items like the roast chicken, lamb meatballs, avocado salad, and various pizzas, highlighting the fresh ingredients and delicious flavors. However, some have found certain dishes to be bland or underwhelming. Overall, Convivo is a popular spot for both casual meals and special occasions, with its ocean views, good food, and happy hour.

Located within the Public Market, Ca'Dario Pizzeria Veloce offers a casual dining experience with personal-sized pizzas at an affordable price. While the pizzas, especially the margherita and carnivore, are generally well-received with a notably good crust, the quality can be inconsistent, with some customers reporting frozen dough and rubbery toppings. The service quality appears to be a significant concern, as multiple reviews mention inattentive, unfriendly, and even rude staff, negatively impacting the overall experience. Although some appreciate the quick service and friendly staff, others have experienced issues with takeout orders and unprofessional behavior.

Pickles & Swiss is a popular deli-style restaurant known for its fresh, flavorful sandwiches and friendly service. The atmosphere is casual and inviting, making it a great spot for a quick lunch while exploring State Street. Highly recommended menu items include the Chipotle Turkey Club, Pot Roast Dipper, and Parma Chicken, with many praising the unique combinations and the freshness of ingredients.  A standout feature is their free dill pickle popcorn, and customers appreciate the option to customize their sandwiches or choose from a variety of wraps, paninis, and salads, including gluten-free and vegan options. While some find it a bit pricey, the quality of the food and the attentive staff generally make it worth the cost, though occasional slow service has been noted.

Buena Onda is a casual Argentinian restaurant known for its exceptional empanadas, which are freshly made with unique and flavorful fillings, including vegan options. The atmosphere is welcoming, with a cozy outdoor courtyard for dining. Customers rave about the flaky, buttery dough and the generous, high-quality ingredients used in fillings like the Carne, Pollo, Caprese, and rotating specials. The chimichurri sauce is a must-try accompaniment. The restaurant also offers catering services and family meals, making it a popular choice for both quick bites and larger events.

The Honor Bar in Santa Barbara is a classy yet casual restaurant with a cozy, dark ambiance and a limited menu of well-executed American dishes. The restaurant is known for its attentive service and classic cocktails and apps, offering a welcoming atmosphere with outdoor seating for dining and dogs. Highly recommended menu items include Ding's Crispy Chicken Sandwich, the Honor Burger, and the Thai Steak and Noodle Salad, all praised for their quality ingredients and delicious flavors. While some find the prices a bit high for the portion sizes, especially for takeout orders, the consistent quality of the food and service makes The Honor Bar a popular spot among locals and visitors.

Wingman Rodeo on Milpas Street is a trendy spot known for its diverse and flavorful chicken wings, which many reviewers claim are among the best they've ever had. The restaurant offers a wide variety of sauces and dry rubs, with popular choices including the Strawberry Arbol, Thai Peanut, and Korean BBQ. While some find the Sichuan Tingly flavor to be overly sweet or numbing, the Chipotle Lime and classic Buffalo wings also receive praise, though some desire a spicier Buffalo option. The quality of the wings is generally high, with many noting their crispy texture and meaty size, although some customers have experienced inconsistencies in cooking and seasoning. Besides wings, the menu features well-received items like tater tots, fried cauliflower, and chicken sandwiches, though the coleslaw and fries have received mixed reviews. Despite some reports of slow service and inconsistent food preparation, the restaurant is often commended for its friendly staff and unique flavor combinations, making it a must-try for wing enthusiasts in Santa Barbara.

Domino's Pizza on N Milpas Street receives mixed reviews, with many customers expressing concerns about customer service and order accuracy. Several reviewers reported issues such as long wait times, cold or undercooked pizzas, and missing or incorrect toppings. Some customers have also mentioned rude or unprofessional behavior from employees, including the manager. While a few customers have had positive experiences with fast and accurate service, the prevailing sentiment suggests inconsistent quality and a need for improvement in both food preparation and customer relations.

Goleta Coffee Co and Loca Vivant Kitchen is a cozy, surf-themed coffee shop known for its relaxed atmosphere, making it a popular spot for studying and casual meetups. Customers rave about the variety of coffee blends, particularly the Mexican Organic and Cinnamon Bun flavors, alongside unique menu items like the avocado toast, breakfast burritos, and the club sandwich. The shop also stands out for its vegan-friendly options, house-made almond milk without extra charge, and locally-sourced ingredients, although some find the coffee weak and the food overpriced. With ample seating, free WiFi, and quirky decor featuring license plates and road signs, it's a local favorite, though some reviewers have noted inconsistent service and cleanliness issues.

The Lemon Tree Inn is a mid-century modern hotel with a heated pool, jacuzzi, and gardens, offering a casual and hipster vibe suitable for families with kids. However, the hotel receives mixed reviews, with many guests complaining about the dated and dirty rooms, thin walls, and a strong smell of cleaning products. While some rooms are updated and comfortable, others are described as dungeons with dirty walls and bathrooms. The quality of service also varies, with some guests praising the friendly staff and helpful manager, while others report rude and unaccommodating experiences. The hotel's restaurant, the Crocodile, receives positive feedback for its food and cocktails, but the lack of amenities like refrigerators and consistent Wi-Fi, along with reports of stolen items and safety concerns, detract from the overall experience.

Cesar's Place is a casual, authentic Mexican restaurant known for its generous portions and reasonable prices. A popular spot for seafood, the restaurant is particularly praised for its shrimp cocktails, ceviche, and micheladas, which many reviewers claim are the best in town. Other recommended dishes include the fish tacos, adobada tacos, and Milanesa torta. While most find the food delicious and fresh, some have noted that the carne asada can be bland. The service can be slow and inconsistent, with occasional complaints about long wait times and inattentive staff, though many reviewers have also complimented the friendly and courteous service.

Sushi Bar 29, formerly known as Yume Sushi, is a popular spot known for its fresh and flavorful sushi at reasonable prices, with a friendly and attentive staff providing excellent service. The restaurant has a casual yet date-night-friendly atmosphere with a street view and an open kitchen. Highly recommended dishes include the Lion King roll, Mexicali roll, spicy tuna rice nuggets, and the Katsu Curry Rice, with creative rolls like Mike's Dancing Pants also being a favorite. While most reviewers praise the freshness and quality of the fish, some find the rolls over-sauced, and the menu, though reliable, is not vast.

Oat Bakery is a popular Santa Barbara bakery known for its creative and delicious artisan breads made with local, organic ingredients, including gluten-free and vegan options. The bakery has a charming, local vibe, and it is run by a friendly husband-and-wife team. Customers rave about the unique flavors and high-quality ingredients, with standout items like the Shiitake Shallot loaf, superfood bread, and hygge buns. The vegan truffle cashew cream cheese and pesto spreads are also highly recommended. Be prepared for a line, especially on weekends, but many find the wait worthwhile for the exceptional bread and friendly service.

Woody's Roundup Bar & Grill, located on the Earl Warren Showgrounds, offers a casual, roadhouse-style dining experience with a large, wood-paneled hall and a covered patio. While the atmosphere aims for a honky-tonk vibe with country music and line dancing, the food quality receives criticism. The tri-tip is described as tough and lacking a distinguishable smokehouse flavor, with a too-sweet BBQ sauce being the only saving grace; the beans are runny, though the potato salad receives positive feedback. Service can be inconsistent, with some customers experiencing long waits. Despite the friendly staff and generous portions, the overall consensus suggests that the food needs improvement.

Pizza Guru is a casual, family-friendly pizzeria known for its diverse menu with organic, locally-sourced ingredients, including gluten-free and vegan options. While the atmosphere is generally relaxed with indoor and outdoor seating, some patrons have noted cleanliness issues and inconsistent service quality, ranging from friendly to inattentive. The restaurant offers a wide variety of specialty pizzas, with some popular choices being the Guru Special, Bodhi's BBQ, and Euphoria, and also provides a build-your-own option with numerous toppings. Despite praise for the unique flavor combinations and fresh ingredients, some customers have reported issues with order accuracy, undercooked or cold pizzas, and a lack of attentiveness from the staff, contrasting with the positive comments about the quality of the food.
